intro: Harpelema dillwynia, commonly known as Dillwyn's harpelema, is a species of flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive pod-like fruits. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a range of colors from white to purple. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
